poem:
Title: "Inferno upon the Exchange"

A flame flares on hallowed stones,
Copenhagen's past consumes, bemoans.
Old mercantile heart aflame,
safety in art, the present's claim.
Feathered spire meets its end,
history and the future blend.
Avoid, they say, this sight of dread,
yet in the fire, life is shed.
Through crackling fear, hope takes flight,
beauty born from morning's blight.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Europe live: fire breaks out at Copenhagen’s old stock exchange 10.00am BST A huge fire has broken out at Copenhagen’s 17th-century former stock exchange, one of the Danish capital’s most famous landmarks, engulfing the historic building’s roof and toppling its distinctive spire. People were seen rushing in and out of the building carrying works of art to safety and Danish media reported an annexe of the parliament had been evacuated. Police asked people to avoid". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
